attributes.action: Change the law to put a stop to dangerous misinformation from all media.
attributes.additional_details: False news throughout media platforms which have the sole intention of swaying public opinion should be met with stronger legislation. When news is intended to create a dangerous bias, attacks on individuals or societel groups may increase, leading to extremism and increased hate crime. Weaponising news to push the ideas of individuals or organisations created to affect a population, which could lead to extreme views or outcomes, should be illegal.
attributes.background: Stronger legislation to crackdown on dangerous misinformation in news reporting, including online social networks. Weaponised news used to create a false narrative aimed at swaying public opinion needs to be illegal and have severe consequences for both the individual creator and the platform.

rejection.details:
The following petitions call for similar actions: 

Require social media companies to implement independent fact-checking 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/713487

Require social media platforms to identify and remove all unsafe content. 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/710557
